meanings.definition: To install software or equipment before it is delivered or used.
meanings.sent1: The technician is preinstalling the new software on all the computers.
meanings.sent2: Before shipping, the company is preinstalling the necessary updates on the devices.
meanings.sent3: The robots are preinstalling the games on the consoles for the big event.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a magician preinstalling magic spells into the devices.
meanings.sent5: The idea of preinstalling safety features in the cars saved many lives.

meanings.definition: The act of setting up or preparing something for use in advance.
meanings.sent1: The preinstalling of the equipment made the setup process much faster.
meanings.sent2: We always do the preinstalling of the software to avoid delays during the event.
meanings.sent3: The preinstalling of the decorations for the party was a fun task.
meanings.sent4: His meticulous preinstalling of the presentation materials impressed the team.
meanings.sent5: The preinstalling of the picnic area with blankets and snacks was a thoughtful gesture.
